subject: AI
title: Recommendation Systems
description: How Netflix, Spotify, and Amazon guess what you want next.

hook.text: Spotify suggests a song you've never heard and you love it. How did it know?

buildup.text: Two main approaches: collaborative filtering (people like you also liked X) and content-based filtering (this song has similar features to songs you already like).

discovery.text: Netflix's recommendation engine saves them an estimated $1 billion per year by reducing churn. People stay when they find things they enjoy.

twist.text: Recommendations create filter bubbles: you see more of what you already like, less of what's different. The model optimizes for engagement, not exploration.

climax.text: Good recommender systems balance relevance (you'll like this) with diversity (try something new). Pure optimization leads to echo chambers.

punchline.text: The algorithm knows your taste â€” but it also shapes it. Be aware of the loop.
